channel.title: Comments on: Webhooks, REST and the Open Web

item.title: By: W van Dam
item.dc:creator: W van Dam
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/09/12/webhooks/#comment-249">julien51</a>.
Resthook are actually exactly the same as Webhooks*. However, their docs are a good introduction on scenarios you got to keep in mind when setting up webhooks. They also got a few basic case studies on how others implemented webhooks.
*) The only difference they state is that Resthooks can be subscribed to via REST as opposed to via a webform, which is a rather obvious step to take and something Jeff Lindsey already mentioned years ago.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to julien51.

Resthook are actually exactly the same as Webhooks*. However, their docs are a good introduction on scenarios you got to keep in mind when setting up webhooks. They also got a few basic case studies on how others implemented webhooks.

*) The only difference they state is that Resthooks can be subscribed to via REST as opposed to via a webform, which is a rather obvious step to take and something Jeff Lindsey already mentioned years ago.

item.title: By: julien51
item.dc:creator: julien51
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/09/12/webhooks/#comment-247">Johnny Jelinek IV</a>.
Not really. They're just a proprietary attempt to compete with an open protocol.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Johnny Jelinek IV.

Not really. They’re just a proprietary attempt to compete with an open protocol.

item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/09/12/webhooks/#comment-246">Nightwolf</a>.
REST hooks are an evolution of webhooks.

In reply to Nightwolf.

REST hooks are an evolution of webhooks.
